abstracts.cdata!:
The purpose of the Water Supply
            Engineering and Technical Assistance Project for Yemen was
            to formulate a phased program of works to meet the urban
            water needs in Greater Aden and Mukalla up to the year 2000,
            as well as preliminary design for the Laboos area. Potential
            sources for the supply of water to these towns had to be
            investigated and a long-term program for the collection and
            rational use of these resources had to be recommended to
            Public Water Corporation (PWC). In addition to these
            technical aspects, a review of PWC's administrative and
            financial policies had to be undertaken and ways to improve
            them and strengthen PWC's management capability had to
            be set forth. A comprehensive tariff study for PWC had also
            to be undertaken under the project and alternative water
            rates capable of ensuring PWC's financial viability had
            to be evaluated. The examination of a national tariff
            structure to alleviate the existing financial burdens of
            some of the small provincial towns, where rates were much
            higher than in Aden, had also to be undertaken. The studies
            started in November 1978 with a three-month delay in the
            original implementation schedule. The Development Credit
            Agreement provided that the project would be completed by
            March 31, 1980. Actually the studies were completed in
            December 1980, some nine months behind the appraisal
            schedule, due to delays in obtaining PWC's financial
            statements and some technical data and PWC's lengthy
            review of the draft documents, and the time required to
            incorporate many additions and amendments requested by PWC
            and International Development Association (IDA). This small
            delay had, however, no effect on the first objective, set
            out in undertaking the studies, which was the formulation of
            a construction project for Greater Aden.
